channel.title: Packet Reading [Help]
channel.description:
3D 00 00 05 00 B6 3E 52 00 01 00 80 96 98 00
This is the packet I'm trying to learn how to read these... I know this is a smart community now could someone explain? :confused: Thank you :D ;)

item.title: Packet Reading [Help]
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

With absolutely no context this is near impossible for us to help you decipher easily.

using: http://www.asciitohex.com/

[b]BASE64:[/b] PQAABQC2PlIAAQCAlpgA

Edit:

The packet you posted is hexadecimal, so my first point of call was to find an does-everything-with-hex online converter. Base64 is a group of encoding schemes that represent binary data in string format, probably the most readable possible solution, as I dont think any normal person can read binary knowing exactly what it is straight away.

more info on hex: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hexadecimal

Read full topic
